shows.title: Faith & Modern Tech / Astrology & Self-Discovery
shows.first_half: First Half: Guest host Lisa Garr (email) welcomes filmmaker, scientist, and storyteller Ron Meyer for a timely discussion about the questions facing our world today, relating to consciousness, faith, technology, and the evolving role of spirituality in an age shaped by AI and global change.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Madi Murphy, author of In the Cosmic Zone and founder of CosmicRx, will dive into how astrology is more than just memes and Mercury retrograde—it's a revolutionary tool for self-discovery, healing, and personal empowerment.

shows.title: Predictions & Cosmic Changes / Searching for UFOs
shows.first_half: First Half: Rogue scholar John Hogue will present his life messages and predictions as well as give us his take on the current events that are at the forefront of our society. Hogue will talk about past predictions he has made that have come true and will also discuss America's rebirth in the wake of cosmic changes.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Ex-Navy man Steve Barone will share his story of how his life was irrevocably changed by two separate, close-up UFO sightings. Barone will discuss how the encounters ignited a personal mission to move beyond casual observation and become a dedicated sky watcher.

shows.title: Chemtrails & Weather / Ouija Board History
shows.first_half: First Half: Scott Stevens was a TV weatherman for 20 years before he became intrigued by chemtrails and the potential manipulation of the planet’s weather. He will share his latest research into our world's weather patterns, as well as the effects of chemtrails and what we need to do to be prepared.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Robert Murch is president of the Talking Board Historical Society and the world's foremost collector, historian, and expert on Ouija. He will discuss the history of Ouija and other talking boards along with their cultural significance, exploring people's fear and fascination.

shows.title: Strange Criminology / Connecting with Archangels
shows.first_half: First Half: Criminologist and photographer Paul Rimmasch will discuss the intersection of law enforcement, forensic science, and the strange and unexplained. He'll also bring us information on officers who have encountered cryptids and possible changelings.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Alisha Das, an authority on spirituality and angels, will explain how archangels act as bridges to God, providing us with tangible spiritual experiences. She'll share the vital reasons why we should want to connect to archangels, and how to recognize the ways to do it.

shows.title: Dark Global Forces / Mysteries of Time
shows.first_half: First Half: Lecturer Daniel Estulin will detail the surveillance, technology, and corporations that seem to control the world, and why we are drawn to them. He'll talk about power groups such as the Freemasons, as well as supranational structures that run society from behind the scenes.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Emmy-Award winning producer and videographer Tim Swartz will discuss the mystery of time, how it has been perceived in the past, and the various deities thought to control it. He'll also share the many reported mysterious events involving time that relate to UFO encounters and hauntings.

shows.title: Magick & Haunted Dolls / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Guest host Ryan Wrecker (email) welcomes psychic medium Patti Negri to discuss her unique blend of Old-World magick and modern spiritual practices. She'll explore the powerful world of haunted dolls and poppet magick, share stories from her work in TV and film, and speak about the paranormal events she's witnessed firsthand. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half—give Ryan a call and discuss whatever's on your mind!
